Advertisement View all journals Search Log in Content Explore content About the journal Publish with us Sign up for alerts RSS feed nature scientific reports conference proceedings article Diamond photonic crystal slab: Leaky modes and modified photoluminescence emission of surface-deposited quantum dots Download PDF Download PDF Conference Proceeding Open access Published: 03 December 2012 Diamond photonic crystal slab: Leaky modes and modified photoluminescence emission of surface-deposited quantum dots Lukáš Ondič 1 , 2 , 3 , Oleg Babchenko 1 , Marián Varga 1 , Alexander Kromka 1 , Jiří Čtyroký 4 & … Ivan Pelant 1 Show authors Scientific Reports volume 2 , Article number: 914 ( 2012 ) Cite this article 62k Accesses 19 Citations 5 Altmetric Metrics details Subjects Materials science Optical physics Optics and photonics Optical spectroscopy Abstract Detailed analysis of a band diagram of a photonic crystal (PhC) slab prepared on a nano-diamond layer is presented. Even though the PhC is structurally imperfect, the existence of leaky modes, determined both theoretically and experimentally in the broad spectral region, implies that an efficient light interaction with a material periodicity occurs in the sample. It is shown that the luminescence emission spectrum of a light source placed directly on the PhC surface can be modified by employing the optical modes of the studied structure. We stress also the impact of intrinsic optical losses of the nan

Log In Sign Up Log In Sign Up more About Press Papers Terms Privacy Copyright We're Hiring! Help Center less Outline keyboard_arrow_down Title Abstract Key Takeaways Figures Results Discussion Methods References FAQs All Topics Engineering Materials Science download Download Free PDF Download Free PDF Diamond photonic crystal slab: Leaky modes and modified photoluminescence emission of surface-deposited quantum dots Jiří Čtyroký 2012, Scientific Reports https://doi.org/10.1038/SREP00914 visibility … description 6 pages description See full PDF download Download PDF bookmark Save to Library share Share close Sign up for access to the world's latest research Sign up for free arrow_forward check Get notified about relevant papers check Save papers to use in your research check Join the discussion with peers check Track your impact Abstract AI This research investigates the characteristics of leaky modes in a photonic crystal (PhC) slab constructed on a nano-diamond layer and their effect on photoluminescence (PL) emissions from surface-deposited quantum dots. The study finds that despite structural imperfections, significant light interaction occurs, allowing modification of PL spectra based on optical modes of the PhC. The research also highlights the impact of intrinsic optical losses in diamond on PL alterations, demonstrating the role of guided modes in light extraction and their implications for potentially enhancing optical device performance. ... Read more Key takeaways AI Leaky modes exist in structurally imperfect nano-diamond photonic crystal slabs, enhancing light interaction. Quantum dots' photoluminescence can be modified by aligning their emission with leaky mode

Advertisement View all journals Search Log in Content Explore content About the journal Publish with us Sign up for alerts RSS feed nature scientific reports conference proceedings article Efficient light coupling for optically excited high-density metallic nanotip arrays Download PDF Download PDF Conference Proceeding Open access Published: 03 December 2012 Efficient light coupling for optically excited high-density metallic nanotip arrays Anna Mustonen 1 , Paul Beaud 2 , Eugenie Kirk 1 , Thomas Feurer 3 & … Soichiro Tsujino 1 Show authors Scientific Reports volume 2 , Article number: 915 ( 2012 ) Cite this article 28k Accesses 26 Citations 2 Altmetric Metrics details Subjects Applied physics Optical physics Optics and photonics Ultrafast photonics Abstract Ultrafast electron pulses can be produced from sharp metallic tips illuminated by femtosecond near infrared laser pulses. Use of an array of metallic nanotips for high charge bunch generation and accelerator applications is also feasible but the small fraction of the emitter tip area limits the quantum efficiency. We therefore propose a submicron-pitch, high-density nanotip array device with a gate electrode, that can support surface-plasmon polaritons. From a theoretical analysis for a device with an asymmetric emitter position, a factor ~30 increased array quantum efficiency is demonstrated. trajectory.actor_reasoning:
I compared the four 2012 Scientific Reports conference proceedings: two are explicitly plasmonic and the nanotip arrays paper mentions surface-plasmon polaritons; the remaining article “Diamond photonic crystal slab...” studies a nanodiamond (nanocrystalline diamond) photonic crystal slab, so removing the prefix gives the compound. 
FINAL ANSWER: diamond

Advertisement View all journals Search Log in Content Explore content About the journal Publish with us Sign up for alerts RSS feed nature scientific reports conference proceedings article Diamond photonic crystal slab: Leaky modes and modified photoluminescence emission of surface-deposited quantum dots Download PDF Download PDF Conference Proceeding Open access Published: 03 December 2012 Diamond photonic crystal slab: Leaky modes and modified photoluminescence emission of surface-deposited quantum dots Lukáš Ondič 1 , 2 , 3 , Oleg Babchenko 1 , Marián Varga 1 , Alexander Kromka 1 , Jiří Čtyroký 4 & … Ivan Pelant 1 Show authors Scientific Reports volume 2 , Article number: 914 ( 2012 ) Cite this article 62k Accesses 19 Citations 5 Altmetric Metrics details Subjects Materials science Optical physics Optics and photonics Optical spectroscopy Abstract Detailed analysis of a band diagram of a photonic crystal (PhC) slab prepared on a nano-diamond layer is presented. Even though the PhC is structurally imperfect, the existence of leaky modes, determined both theoretically and experimentally in the broad spectral region, implies that an efficient light interaction with a material periodicity occurs in the sample. It is shown that the luminescence emission spectrum of a light source placed directly on the PhC surface can be modified by employing the optical modes of the studied structure. We stress also the impact of intrinsic optical losses of the nan

Log In Sign Up Log In Sign Up more About Press Papers Terms Privacy Copyright We're Hiring! Help Center less Outline keyboard_arrow_down Title Abstract Key Takeaways Figures Results Discussion Methods References FAQs All Topics Engineering Materials Science download Download Free PDF Download Free PDF Diamond photonic crystal slab: Leaky modes and modified photoluminescence emission of surface-deposited quantum dots Jiří Čtyroký 2012, Scientific Reports https://doi.org/10.1038/SREP00914 visibility … description 6 pages description See full PDF download Download PDF bookmark Save to Library share Share close Sign up for access to the world's latest research Sign up for free arrow_forward check Get notified about relevant papers check Save papers to use in your research check Join the discussion with peers check Track your impact Abstract AI This research investigates the characteristics of leaky modes in a photonic crystal (PhC) slab constructed on a nano-diamond layer and their effect on photoluminescence (PL) emissions from surface-deposited quantum dots. The study finds that despite structural imperfections, significant light interaction occurs, allowing modification of PL spectra based on optical modes of the PhC. The research also highlights the impact of intrinsic optical losses in diamond on PL alterations, demonstrating the role of guided modes in light extraction and their implications for potentially enhancing optical device performance. ... Read more Key takeaways AI Leaky modes exist in structurally imperfect nano-diamond photonic crystal slabs, enhancing light interaction. Quantum dots' photoluminescence can be modified by aligning their emission with leaky mode

Advertisement View all journals Search Log in Content Explore content About the journal Publish with us Sign up for alerts RSS feed nature scientific reports conference proceedings article Efficient light coupling for optically excited high-density metallic nanotip arrays Download PDF Download PDF Conference Proceeding Open access Published: 03 December 2012 Efficient light coupling for optically excited high-density metallic nanotip arrays Anna Mustonen 1 , Paul Beaud 2 , Eugenie Kirk 1 , Thomas Feurer 3 & … Soichiro Tsujino 1 Show authors Scientific Reports volume 2 , Article number: 915 ( 2012 ) Cite this article 28k Accesses 26 Citations 2 Altmetric Metrics details Subjects Applied physics Optical physics Optics and photonics Ultrafast photonics Abstract Ultrafast electron pulses can be produced from sharp metallic tips illuminated by femtosecond near infrared laser pulses. Use of an array of metallic nanotips for high charge bunch generation and accelerator applications is also feasible but the small fraction of the emitter tip area limits the quantum efficiency. We therefore propose a submicron-pitch, high-density nanotip array device with a gate electrode, that can support surface-plasmon polaritons. From a theoretical analysis for a device with an asymmetric emitter position, a factor ~30 increased array quantum efficiency is demonstrated. messages.name: enhanced_search

messages.content:
I compared the four 2012 Scientific Reports conference proceedings: two are explicitly plasmonic and the nanotip arrays paper mentions surface-plasmon polaritons; the remaining article “Diamond photonic crystal slab...” studies a nanodiamond (nanocrystalline diamond) photonic crystal slab, so removing the prefix gives the compound. 
FINAL ANSWER: diamond
